biogHist.abstract: This Series of Admission Registers comprises two registers of handwritten entries about girls who were admitted to St Joseph's Orphanage, Goulburn.
biogHist.p: Application for access must be made, in writing, to the Archivist, providing personal identification documents to establish the right to access information. Physical access to the records is not permitted due to their fragility and the need to protect the confidentiality of information concerning other persons. Information will be forwarded by mail.

The Admission registers are managed by the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy of Australia and Papua New Guinea (ISMAPNG). ISMAPNG formed out of the consolidation of 14 of the 17 congregations of the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy in Australia, and from the region of Papua New Guinea. This included the Goulburn Congregation, which ran St Joseph's Orphanage, Goulburn.

The information in the registers in this Series includes: Name, DOB, birthplace, mother's name, father's name, date of admission, date of discharge. The name of at least one parent appears in each entry. If siblings came into care their details are also recorded. It is not always possible to determine the exact reason for admission. Related records include personal record cards and some baptismal certificates.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: ISMAPNG Archives - Institute Centre in Stanmore, New South Wales (2012 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The ISMAPNG Archives, Stanmore holds the Admission Registers, St Joseph's Orphanage, Goulburn.

descriptiveNote.p: Copies of the Admission Registers are held at CatholicCare Sydney.

descriptiveNote.p: The Admission Registers were managed by the Sisters of Mercy, Goulburn Congregational Centre until 2012.
